The Sport Sail style features a multifunction utility dial, surrounded by diamondsthe luxurious side of sportswear. 18-karat yellow gold plated round stainless steel case. Diamonds on bezel; 0.46 total diamond carat weight. White enamel guilloche dial with three-hand chronograph movement; Arabic numerals, gold markers, and swirl design. Three subdials; date window; stopwatch function. Sapphire crystal. Water resistant to 5 ATM. Interchangeable with any 20mm Michele Watches strap. Imported. picture frames / photo frames: This gorgeous piece from the Julia Knight collection is a wonderful example of genuine hand inlay work. Set into a fine silver finish base this piece is fabulous when one examines its intricate mother-of-pearl detail and white French guilloche style hand enamelling. Because of the nature of hand inlay work each piece may have minute differences that enhance its beauty. SendAFrame proudly carries this entire collection for your photo frame shopping convenience. This egg was originally made for Varvara Kelkh, a wealthy Russian heiress, who commissioned seven Easter eggs which rivaled in importance and beauty those given to Empress Fedorovna.The Kelkh Daster eggs have, on occasions, been sold as Imperial eggs. This egg is composed of overlapping disks enameled blue over a guilloche ground with more than 1000 Austrian crystals. The egg holds a miniature elephant inside which in turn holds a cobalt blue egg pendant. Signed with included certificate. Size: 2 1/2"Diam. ( In stock ) The 2012 Collection continues in the spirit of artistic mastery and the tradition of Old World craftsmanship by combining the centuries-old technique of Guilloché with the art and expertise... More
The 2012 Collection continues in the spirit of artistic mastery and the tradition of Old World craftsmanship by combining the centuries-old technique of Guilloché with the art and expertise of Hard Enamel. Using a mortar and pestle, a composition of glass, water and metal oxides is ground for hours by hand. When settled, the water is removed, leaving the fine paste that is the basis for hard enamel. A quill is then used to apply each coat of the mixture to the surface of the metal, ensuring that the entire guilloché area is completely covered in enamel. The components are then fired in a furnace at temperatures exceeding 1,000° F, fusing the enamel to the metal and forming a layer of glass.After cooling, the pieces are manually ground with a diamond file, restoring their proper shape and surface. This tedious process is repeated at length until the level of enamel reaches the depth required to cover the peaks and fill the valleys of each intricate guilloché pattern. When the final stages of firing are completed, the pieces are polished and buffed, revealing the velvet finish of translucent hard enamel. Production of translucent hard enamel demands the highest levels of patience, experience and skill. A five-year apprenticeship is required to ensure that the highest levels of quality will be met in each individual Collection piece.Please see other collection in David Oscarson Fountain Pen.We also sell other Fountain Pen Refill. ADDITIONAL INFO: Genuine Product from David Oscarson. Buy from Authorized Major dealer only , with confidence.Brand New Product. Guaranteed for quality. Space-saving design and easy-roll casters make Midwest Folding Products' Mobile Table a great choice for your school cafeteria or multipurpose room. Shur-Lok automatic safety locks mean you can fold and roll the table out of the way without the worry of accidents. When the table is unfolded and in place, casters lift off the ground to ensure stability. Backed by a 15-year warranty. Choose from several attractive colors for the top and edge banding for this rectangle-shaped table. ( In stock ) The David Oscarson Trellis Black and White Broad Rhodium Vermeil Fountain Pen. The Trellis Collection is the seventh in the David Oscarson™ series of Limited Edition writing instruments... More
The David Oscarson Trellis Black and White Broad Rhodium Vermeil Fountain Pen. The Trellis Collection is the seventh in the David Oscarson™ series of Limited Edition writing instruments. Produced in five color variations, each will be limited to production of 88 pieces (including fountain pens and roller balls). The Trellis Collection continues in the spirit of artistic mastery and the tradition of Old World craftsmanship by combining the centuries-old technique of Guilloché with the art and expertise of Hard Enamel. The Trellis Collection incorporates multiple levels of Guilloché on each Collection piece. The four colors of translucent hard enamel in the Trellis Collection are accented with opalescent white hard enamel and finished in 18-karat Yellow Gold and Rhodium vermeil. The fifth Trellis Collection piece features opalescent White hard enamel accented in translucent black, finished in 18-kt. Yellow Gold vermeil. The "leaf and bud" motif of the Trellis Collection requires multiple stages of engraving; the entire body of the pen is first cut down to the level of the guilloché pattern underneath. The pattern is then engraved onto the background of the body of the pen, omitting the trellis, and leaf and bud designs which remain in high relief.Please see other collections in David-Oscarson Fountain Pen.We also sell other Fountain Pen Refill. The David Oscarson Trellis Azure Blue and White Medium Rhodium Vermeil Fountain Pen. The Trellis Collection is the seventh in the David Oscarson™ series of Limited Edition writing instruments. Produced in five color variations, each will be limited to production of 88 pieces (including fountain pens and roller balls). The Trellis Collection continues in the spirit of artistic mastery and the tradition of Old World craftsmanship by combining the centuries-old technique of Guilloché with the art and expertise of Hard Enamel. The Trellis Collection incorporates multiple levels of Guilloché on each Collection piece. The four colors of translucent hard enamel in the Trellis Collection are accented with opalescent white hard enamel and finished in 18-karat Yellow Gold and Rhodium vermeil. The fifth Trellis Collection piece features opalescent White hard enamel accented in translucent black, finished in 18-kt. Yellow Gold vermeil. The "leaf and bud" motif of the Trellis Collection requires multiple stages of engraving; the entire body of the pen is first cut down to the level of the guilloché pattern underneath. The pattern is then engraved onto the background of the body of the pen, omitting the trellis, and leaf and bud designs which remain in high relief. This grounded, 3-wire, microfluorescent T5 light fixture includes a 360 degree adjustable light shield for those applications where shielding light is important. It also includes the lamp, mounting brackets and screws, direct connector, and built-in, instant-on, energy- efficient, silent, electronic ballast. A very versatile light fixture for both home and office, the microfluorescent adjustable T5 grounded light fixture can be used for backlighting, cabinet lighting, cove lighting, desk lighting, display case lighting, exhibits, merchandising, over cabinet lighting, shelf lights, showcase lighting, task lighting, trade show lighting, and under cabinet lighting. ( In stock ) picture frames / photo frames: A master jeweler celebrated for his fanciful creations Peter Carl Fabergé elevated the art of exquisite guilloché enameling to new heights. Fabergé was the... More
picture frames / photo frames: A master jeweler celebrated for his fanciful creations Peter Carl Fabergé elevated the art of exquisite guilloché enameling to new heights. Fabergé was the world’s greatest master of this art form a time-intensive technique in which polychrome enamel is layered over circular straight or wave patterns engraved on metal. The Museum’s gold-plated hand-enameled frame with crystal stones is based on a gold picture frame with guilloché enamel in the Museum’s collection created by Fabergé’s studios about 1916. Features h and-enameling with gold overlay and faceted cyrstals. Frame displays a 5"x7" photo or print. To view the complete collection visit The Metropolitan Museum of Art® Collection Produced in cooperation with the British Royal Collection. The David Oscarson Trellis White and Black Broad 18kt. Yellow Gold Vermeil Fountain Pen. The Trellis Collection is the seventh in the David Oscarson™ series of Limited Edition writing instruments. Produced in five color variations, each will be limited to production of 88 pieces (including fountain pens and roller balls). The Trellis Collection continues in the spirit of artistic mastery and the tradition of Old World craftsmanship by combining the centuries-old technique of Guilloché with the art and expertise of Hard Enamel. The Trellis Collection incorporates multiple levels of Guilloché on each Collection piece. The four colors of translucent hard enamel in the Trellis Collection are accented with opalescent white hard enamel and finished in 18-karat Yellow Gold and Rhodium vermeil. The fifth Trellis Collection piece features opalescent White hard enamel accented in translucent black, finished in 18-kt. Yellow Gold vermeil. The "leaf and bud" motif of the Trellis Collection requires multiple stages of engraving; the entire body of the pen is first cut down to the level of the guilloché pattern underneath. The pattern is then engraved onto the background of the body of the pen, omitting the trellis, and leaf and bud designs which remain in high relief. Opalescent White and Translucent Black Enamel with 18-kt. Yellow Gold Vermeil.Please see other collections in David-Oscarson Fountain Pen.We also sell other Fountain Pen Refill.
